routes.description: Sit start with hands on two good incut holds. Make a move out to the lip and hand traverse the lip rightwards until a long move gets a good slot hold on the arete. Heel hook, work the hands up the arete and rock over, and enjoy the change in scene. Make a couple of balancy moves up the arete until possible to lean right to a good edge which is used to move up to the top of the slab. From here scuttle of right towards the gully.

boulders.name: Traingle boulders
boulders.description: These high-quality boulders face north and have a few quality boulder problems or topropes on impeccable rock. They are located directly below the road in the vicinity of the upper parking lot, on the north side of the hill.

routes.name: Side Problem
routes.description: Climb the short face vial a right-slanting crack.

routes.name: Problem D
routes.description: Climb up and grab the left arete and then romp all the way to the top of the slab.

routes.name: Low Level Girdle
routes.description: Start at Problem D on the left and make a fingery traverse across Triangle Face, and then into the wide crack and around the nose of Isosceles. Continue rightwards to a final tricky section to reach the arete on the right of Triangulation.

routes.name: Triangle Face
routes.description: Climb the tall face to the apex of the boulder.

routes.name: Problem C
routes.description: Climb the right arete of the slab until 2/3 height when an exciting lieback gains the top.

routes.name: Isosceles
routes.description: Start up the slabby arete, until the ledge at 2/3 height is reached. From the ledge make very committing moves up the arete.

routes.name: Problem B
routes.description: Climb the left arete of the slab up and right as it nears the apex of the slab.

routes.name: Problem A
routes.description: Climb up the left of the slab directly with good positive holds

routes.name: Triangulation
routes.description: Climb the right-hand face of the right-hand boulder.

routes.name: Soft Grit
routes.description: On the boulder to the right of Triangulation, start with your right hand on a good, but sharp, shallow pocket, left hand high on a crimp. Pull on step up high and slap for the gritty sloper, match then mantle on up.

boulders.name: Harrison Boulder
boulders.description: The obvious U-shaped boulder down the hill from the Island area.

routes.name: Problem A
routes.description: Pull up and mantle onto the ledge then follow the slab up to the top of the boulder.

routes.name: The Mug
routes.description: On the east side of the boulder is this short- but-sweet (and steep) problem.

routes.name: The Handle
routes.description: Right of The Mug, start with left hand on clear edge around the corner and right hand on sloper to the right. Throw right hand up to a pretty solid hold and a left throw directly above you to a solid jug.

routes.name: Problem B
routes.description: Climb the northwest arete of the boulder.

routes.name: Crank Like a Cancer
routes.description: On the left side of the downhill face, start up on good edges until possible to traverse left 4'. From here make a delicate sequence up to the overhang which is passed on the left.

routes.name: Thumbelina
routes.description: Just left of center on the boulder's northwest face, steepish moves on good holds at the start lead to a very large hold, which is used to gain entry into a somewhat-committing corner. A little balancey at top. Most choose to toprope.

routes.name: Cherry Dip Scoop
routes.description: In-cut holds on a slightly overhanging face lead to a tricky and committing move onto a slab.

boulders.name: Turtle Dome
boulders.description: North of the bridge on the hill's northwest side, walk down in the vicinity of a small dirt pull-out towards the split, round boulder.

routes.name: Turtle Dome Crack
routes.description: Tight hands lead to one or two perfect jams and then the crack becomes wider than you'd like far too quickly.

boulders.name: Half Moon Boulder - Center
boulders.description: A big boulder downhill from the Turtle Dome

routes.name: Half Moon Crack
routes.description: An awesome, burly, wide hands crack.

routes.name: Full Moon
routes.description: Make a delicate fingery sequence of moves to gain the bottom of the water chute. From here, continue to make balancy moves up the chute until better holds appear for the left hand. Stay cool, and continue up the scoop, finishing up the rough cracks at the top of the boulder.

boulders.name: Peppertree Arete Wall
boulders.description: A small wall is situated along the access road.

routes.name: Peppertree Left
routes.description: Start on the left and climb up passing a black notch to gain the slabby finish.

routes.name: Peppertree Arete
routes.description: Start with a balancy sequence of moves up below the blunt arete. Gain the thin left hand hold then reach / stretch up to a good sharp flake for the right. Pull on, then continue up more easily to the top.

routes.name: Peppertree Right
routes.description: Start below the arete and move up and right via a good sidepull. Make a couple of hard pulls to get established on the slab above then finish direct.

boulders.name: John Long Boulder
boulders.description: This huge boulder is perched on a steep hillside just downslope from the Hardy Boy Boulder.

routes.name: Stinky Rabbit Crankin's For Kids
routes.description: On the far left side of the boulder, start low off a left hand undercling and right hand crimp.

routes.name: The Runaway
routes.description: Start on the left and climb the slabby face.

routes.name: J. Elvis
routes.description: Climb the right side of the slabby wall more or less direct.

routes.name: Momma's in New York
routes.description: Start below the square cut arete with difficulty. Force a couple of moves up the arete, and when the good holds are reached call it done and wander to the top.

routes.name: The Big Guy
routes.description: Start in the middle of the face and gain a good notch hold. From here traverse delicately left to a couple of good, but small, holds. Once these holds are reached continue straight up to the top.

routes.name: The Arete
routes.description: Start below the arete on the left. Pull on and jump the feet up, the follow the arete directly on good holds.
